title: Afton Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Robert Guthrie / Afton Reservoir, New Cumnock
images.caption: Afton Reservoir, New Cumnock. With Cannock Hill in the background.

images.title: bill copland / Flow gently, sweet Afton.
images.caption: Flow gently, sweet Afton. The Afton Water flows northwards through the forest to enter the Afton Reservoir. Much of the forest has been felled in recent years

images.title: Robert Guthrie / Monthraw Cottage
images.caption: Ruins of Monthraw Cottage overlooking Afton Reservoir. 'The Lone Monthraw Where man never heard His neighbour's cock craw'

description: This walk visits the Afton Reservoir and Dam near New Cumnock in Ayrshire. The pretty lake is in a remote spot so ideal for a peaceful walk. There are nice woodland trails leading around the site with views of the River Afton and the surrounding hills to enjoy nearby. See the video below for great views of the dam and Afton Water.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head south west and there's more nice waterside walks to be found around Loch Doon and Loch Bradan in the Galloway Forest Park.  To the east there's the pretty waterfall at Crichope Linn and the small but delightful Loch Ettrick on the edge of the Ae Forest. The long distance Romans and Reivers Route also starts in the forest. This 52 mile route follows the old Roman Roads to Hawick in the Scottish Borders. Following the trail north east will take you to Moffat where you can enjoy a riverside walk along the River Annan on the Annadale Way. Near here there's also the 17th century Drumlanrig Castle. The castle is surrounded by extensive grounds with several waymarked walking paths and some challenging mountain bike trails to try.

display_address: New Cumnock, East Ayrshire, Alba / Scotland, KA18 4AT, United Kingdom
